text: I do want to be part of the national
debate i think our country's in trouble
on spending we've watched our founders
view of federalism that is powered
evolved to the states today on the
caucus a conversation with Virginia
Governor Bob McDonnell he worked his way
up the Republican ladder in Virginia
from state delegate to Attorney General
and now governor of the Commonwealth
along the way he's become a voice
Republicans across the country are
listening to we sat down with him in the
ceremonial Cabinet Room in Richmond's
Capitol building Governor McDonnell
thanks for joining us at the caucus at
the New York Times glad if you too Mike
thank you before we start in with some
of the other questions let me ask you
about the tornadoes that swept through
the south and unfortunately killed some
folks here in Virginia how do things
stand at this point I could say it's
it's a real blow a lot of these have
been in rural areas of the of the state
we've got some discretionary money I've
declared disaster a state of emergency
here in Virginia so the discretionary
money that I've got available will be
able to help I did speak to this
President and Secretary Napolitano
yesterday and assuming we can meet the
federal thresholds for a FEMA or federal
declaration that will trigger more
relief but until the full disaster
analysis is done we don't know but it is
a time of a tough time in Virginia let's
talk a little bit about the 2012
presidential campaign I heard there was
one cutter was there is one which of the
Republican candidates are maybe the
potential Republican candidates do you
think are talking about the right set of
issues why I like others and i'll tell
you why not just because I'm one but I
do know from the office that the buck
stops at your desk so that doesn't get
me very far down to a specific person
that you look at just so many many of
them are governors including yourself
mitch Daniels I like Miss Janet she's an
exceptional governor he's is one of the
first guys I talked to after i got
elected because he had such a successful
reform agenda in indiana on big things i
think tim Pawlenty is a world-class guy
major accomplishments in a blue state
got a very good style about him he's
built a rock star campaign team
Romney would have to be considered the
front-runner because he's been there
before he acquitted himself well four
years ago and his expertise is on things
people care about which is spending and
economic development job Christians Newt
Gingrich was one of the best idea guys
in the history of the Congress in recent
years I think he will have some great
ideas to put on the table that contract
with america really really changed the
way Republicans approach government do
you think sarah palin could be the right
person for that job I don't think she's
gonna run just from every sense that
i've got she has certainly added to add
it to the debate by her stances on
federalism and spending you said
recently I think that Donald Trump was
engaging in straight talk and
understands what it takes to grow jobs
that sounds like an endorsement to me
that's not an endorsement there are a
lot of people that are talking about
that but dude I think the room Donald
Trump has been it's been doing straight
talk with all of the talk about the the
presidents birth certificate and is that
the kind of non versation that you
wanted I think those are side issues I
wish everybody just leave that alone
it's been resolved the president's an
American citizen the problem is not
where he was born it's what he's doing
in the White House fast forward a little
bit more than a year from now and your
phone rings and it's one of these folks
that we've been talking about asking you
to be the vice presidential nominee do
you do it you know Mike that's that's a
great what if I think anybody who gets
that call would would be honored and
flattered and would certainly have to
consider it I'm not expecting it and I
want to be part of that debate the best
way possible but first and foremost I've
got the best job in america job held by
Thomas Jefferson and Patrick Henry as
governor virginia so that's what i'm
engaged in but i'm not expecting that
call I want to help us win next year
let's move on to the political fight in
Washington over the nation's debt yes
deficit but none of the plans really do
what governors have to do and that is
balanced a budget every year and get us
out of debt in any any short order I
would want to go further and faster
absolutely and what we have is decades
of Republicans and Democrats in Congress
over-promising and overspending and now
the bills are due politically what
you say to your colleagues especially in
the Republican Party you're going up on
the hill who worried that those cuts are
perceived negatively by their
constituents and questions not what's a
winning political forming the question
is what's right for our country and of
course when you reduce spending there
are various interest groups and various
people that are not going to be happy in
the short run but I think you got to
make the case and be honest and be
straightforward look people in the eye
and say this is what we need to do you
know the doomsday scenarios are always
out there and that that pressure makes
people come to the table and negotiate
same thing with a couple of weeks ago
the threatened government shut down
there I'm going to express confidence
that they're going to find a way to get
that done because I see more Democrats
realizing now that the top issue facing
this country jobs in the economy and
economic opportunity and controlling
taxes and spending social issues to be
marriage abortion to those issues be
part of the discussion and a key part of
the discussion of a public attack
absolutely the show did these issues of
life and family and and marriage really
go to the heart and soul of what we
believe is a free people but sometimes
those issues have a tendency to crowd
out the issues that you said we're most
important true but that doesn't mean you
don't talk about it means you keep them
in the proper context
